1.content: Daenerys, in her early teens, belongs to House Targaryen. She has fair skin, silver-gold hair, and captivating violet eyes. Daenerys is the only daughter of King Aerys II Targaryen and Queen Rhaella, with Rhaegar (deceased) and Viserys as her older siblings. Born on the island-castle of Dragonstone during a fierce summer storm, she earned the moniker "Stormborn." Following the devastating Sack of King's Landing, Daenerys and Viserys were forced into exile in the Free Cities to escape the wrath of Robert Baratheon. Struggling as urchins, they found refuge under the protection of Magister Illyrio Mopatis in the Free City of Pentos. Viserys often mistreats and sexually abuses his sister, although he has always respected her virginity since he intends to sell her in exchange for an army. He often tells his sister that he would allow an entire Dothraki horde and their horses to rape her if he had his kingdom in exchange. Enduring these abuses has strengthened Daenerys, giving her great resistance and a will of steel. Daenerys is timid, with a compassionate heart and empathy towards the oppressed, she is guided by a strong sense of justice.
1.name: Person: Daenerys Targaryen

2.content: Brandon Stark, commonly known as Bran Stark, is the son of Eddard Stark and Catelyn Stark. He is the fourth child and second son in the Stark family, which includes his siblings Robb, Sansa, Arya, Rickon, and his cousin Jon Snow. Bran was born and raised in Winterfell, the ancestral home of House Stark, located in the North. He is ten years old. Bran looks like his mother Catelyn, having the thick auburn hair and deep blue eyes of the Tullys. Bran is a sweet and thoughtful boy, well-loved by everyone at Winterfell. He has a fascination with climbing and exploring along the walls and ramparts of the castle. Catelyn once jested that Bran could climb before he could walk, however, his climbing often distresses her.  He often spies on his parents and siblings. Sometimes he has secretly masturbated while spying on his naked sisters or his parents having sex. Bran has a propensity for adventure and excitement; he yearns to see far off places one day and dreams of becoming a knight. He has a keen interest in archery and receives training from his brothers. He is constantly accompanied by his direwolf, Summer, with whom he shares a strong warg connection.
2.name: Person: Bran Stark

3.content: Prince Doran Nymeros Martell, also known simply as Doran Martell, is the head of House Martell, the Prince of Dorne, and the Lord of Sunspear. Married to Lady Mellario, of the Free City of Norvos, he has three children: Arianne, Quentyn, and Trystane. He's also the elder brother of Elia and Oberyn Martell. In his early fifties, Doran is a cautious, pensive, and subtle man. He is prone to think long on the matters, weighing every word and every action. He has a bad case of gout which has recently left him unable to walk, instead having to rely on his wheeled chair, or a palanquin, to move around. His body is soft and shapeless, and the gout has swollen and reddened the joints of his knees, toes, and hands. He covers his legs and feet with a blanket, blocking the sight of his gout. He is rarely seen in public, as he does not want to appear weak in the eyes of his enemies. Doran has been focused for years on getting revenge for the murder of his sister, Elia, and her two young children during the Sack of King's Landing during Robert's Rebellion in 283 AC. He still has a deep affection for his sister, and had a good relationship with his younger brother as well.
3.name: Person: Doran Martell

4.content: Tyrion Lannister belongs to House Lannister and is the youngest child of Lord Tywin Lannister and the late Lady Joanna Lannister. He is 32. He has two older siblings: Cersei Lannister, who is married to King Robert I Baratheon, and Ser Jaime Lannister, a knight in Robert's Kingsguard. Tyrion is a dwarf and is often referred to as the Imp or the Halfman. His mother, Joanna Lannister, died while giving birth to him, and unfairly, Tywin and Cersei blame Tyrion for her death. Tyrion has stunted legs, stubby fingers, and a protruding forehead. His eyes are different colors, with one green and the other black. Tyrion's fair, nearly white hair has some black strands, and if he grows a beard, it is yellow, white, and black. Despite his physical appearance, Tyrion is highly intelligent, well-educated, and an avid reader. He possesses sharp wit and a quick tongue. Although he is not a skilled warrior, he has received combat training and displays bravery on the battlefield. Tyrion compensates for his lack of size and strength with his mental acuity. Unfortunately, he is often disrespected and subjected to mockery due to his deformity, with the exception of Jaime. Tyrion believes that Jaime is the only one who truly cares for him and is willing to forgive him for anything. While his social status and family's wealth and power offer some protection, Tyrion yearns for love and respect from his family. Tyrion often outwits those who underestimate him or finds clever ways to navigate difficult situations. Additionally, Tyrion demonstrates strategic thinking and possesses a keen mind. Despite enduring mistreatment throughout his life, Tyrion has developed resilience and can brush off insults about his height (except when they come from his father). He becomes upset when the helpless are harmed. He was particularly furious when Janos Slynt carried out an order to kill an innocent baby girl named Barra, one of Robert's illegitimate children. As punishment, Tyrion exiled Janos to the Wall. Tyrion is genuinely loyal to those who treat him with love and respect. However, Tyrion has his flaws. He tends to indulge excessively in food, drink, and sex as a way to cope with the mistreatment he has endured. Additionally, if he feels wronged, he can act viciously. Tywin acknowledges and respects Tyrion's intellect but maintains prejudice against his youngest son. Similarly, Tyrion both fears and admires his father but resents him for his inflexible nature and lack of love for his children.
4.name: Person: Tyrion Lannister

5.content: Sansa Stark is the eldest daughter of Lady Catelyn and Lord Eddard Stark from House Stark. She has three brothers: Robb, Bran, and Rickon, a younger sister named Arya, and a half-brother named Jon Snow. Sansa is 14 years old. She inherits her mother's family features, with high cheekbones, deep blue eyes, and thick, soft auburn hair that is lighter than her mother's. Sansa was raised as a noblewoman and embodies the traditional feminine qualities of her upbringing. She has a strong interest in music, poetry, singing, dancing, embroidery, and other activities typically associated with femininity.  Sansa is a childish and naive girl who knows nothing about sex. Like many girls her age, Sansa is captivated by romantic tales and stories of adventure, especially those featuring handsome princes, honorable knights, chivalry, and love. Sansa and her younger sister Arya often have a strained relationship and are quite different from each other. Her closest friend is Jeyne Poole, the daughter of Winterfell's steward, Vayon Poole. Sansa has a fondness for lemon cakes and owns a direwolf named Lady.
5.name: Person: Sansa Stark

6.content: Winterfell is the ancestral home of House Stark and is considered the capital of the north. It's located in the center of the northernmost province of the Seven Kingdoms, on the kingsroad from Storm's End to the Wall. It sits on the eastern edge of the wolfswood, north of the western branch of the White Knife and Castle Cerwyn. Vayon Poole is the castle's steward, and Maester Luwin advises Lord Eddard Stark. Ser Rodrik Cassel is the master-at-arms, and his nephew Jory Cassel is captain of the House Stark guards. Septon Chayle tends to the castle's sept, and Septa Mordane tutors the Stark children. Other staff members include the master of horse Hullen, the kennelmaster Farlen, the blacksmith Mikken, the cook Gage, and the brewer Barth. Winterfell is a massive castle complex surrounded by two huge granite walls. There's a village outside called the Winter Town. The castle is built around an ancient godswood and natural hot springs. The hot springs pipe water through the walls and chambers, keeping Winterfell warm during harsh winters. Inside the walls, there are many courtyards and open spaces where weapons training and practice take place. The inner ward is an older open space where archery practice occurs, located next to the broken tower. The towers and halls of Winterfell have diamond-shaped windows. The Great Keep is the stronghold of the castle and contains bedchambers for House Stark, including Lord Eddard Stark's solar. It's connected to the armory by a covered bridge, offering a view of the entire yard. Beneath the Great Keep are cellars with narrow windows. The Great Hall is used for receiving guests and dining together. It has wide oak and iron doors opening to the castle yard, and a rear exit leads to a dimly-lit gallery. The hall can accommodate five hundred people with long rows of tables, and there's a raised platform for noble guests. The high seat of the old Kings in the North is in the hall, adorned with carved direwolf heads. There's a small sept built for Lady Catelyn Tully. The ancient godswood has stood untouched for thousands of years, with an ancient weirwood at its center. The Glass Gardens are heated by the hot springs and used for growing fruits, vegetables, and flowers. The crypt of Winterfell, near the First Keep, is where House Stark members are buried. Winterfell also has a bell tower connected to the rookery, a maester's turret below the rookery, a library tower with a winding staircase, a Guards Hall, undercrofts and cellars, and dungeons with tower cells.
6.name: Location: Winterfell

7.content: Petyr Baelish, known as Littlefinger, is the Lord and leader of House Baelish. He serves as the master of coin on King Robert I Baratheon's small council. Instead of his family sigil, which is a titan's head, Petyr chooses to wear a mockingbird as his personal symbol. Petyr has always been clever and cunning. Although he comes from a humble background, his intelligence and ambition have propelled him to a position of power. Petyr is skilled in commerce, manipulation, and political improvisation. Many high lords underestimate him due to his low birth, but Tyrion Lannister recognizes him as a dangerous man. He was raised alongside Catelyn, Lysa, and Edmure, the children of Hoster Tully. Due to his family's holdings and his short stature, Edmure nicknamed him "Littlefinger," a name that stuck. Petyr fell in love with Catelyn, but she saw him only as a brother. Lysa, on the other hand, loved Petyr. When Catelyn was betrothed to Brandon Stark, Petyr tried to kiss her, resulting in her rejection. Heartbroken, Petyr got drunk and ended up sleeping with Lysa, mistaking her for Catelyn. When Catelyn's wedding date with Brandon Stark was announced, Petyr challenged Brandon to a duel but was defeated. Petyr was sent away from Riverrun by Lord Hoster, and Catelyn did not say him goodbye. However, Lysa had become pregnant with Petyr's child as a result of their second sexual encounter. After Petyr had been sent away, Lysa revealed her pregnancy to her father, hoping he would allow Lysa and Petyr to marry. Instead, Hoster, who had believed Petyr to be too lowborn, forced Lysa to drink moon tea to abort the pregnancy. Petyr later sent Catelyn a letter, but she burned it without reading it. Petyr maintained a relationship with Lysa, and when she married Lord Jon Arryn, she convinced her husband to give Petyr control of customs at Gulltown around 289 AC, where he increased incomes tenfold, displaying his skill with finances. Jon Arryn brought Petyr to King's Landing, where he quickly rose to the position of master of coin on the small council. Petyr expanded his influence by placing his trusted people in key positions and engaging in various financial dealings to support the king and the Hand of the King. He also acquired several establishments, including brothels.
7.name: Person: Petyr Baelish

8.content: Rickon Stark is Eddard and Catelyn's youngest child, only three years old. Rickon is a naturally strong-willed child.  He is usually accompanied by his direwolf, Shaggydog. Rickon looks like his mother Catelyn, having the bright blue eyes, auburn hair, and easy smile of a Tully. Young Rickon is playful, but temperamental and stubborn. He has breathless laughter and fiercely tries to be like his older brothers. His bedchamber is half a turn below Bran's in a tower at Winterfell.
8.name: Person: Rickon Stark

9.content: House Hornwood of Hornwood is a noble house whose seat is Hornwood in the north. They are among the principal bannermen of Starks of Winterfell. Their sigil is a bull moose, brown on a field of dark orange. Their words are "Righteous in Wrath". The lands of the house, which include the forest of the Hornwood and other castles beside Hornwood, border those of House Manderly and extend west to the White Knife. The current Lord of Hornwood is Lord Halys Hornwood. Lady Berena Hornwood, Lord Halys's sister, is wed to Leobald Tallhart.
9.name: House: Hornwood

10.content: House Tallhart of Torrhen's Square is a noble house from the north and is among the principal houses sworn to House Stark. The house's sigil consists of three green sentinel trees on a brown background. Their house words are "Proud and Free". Eddara Tallhart is the new Lady of Torrhen's Square and the head of the house. She is a a young maid. Eddara has two cousins: Brandon Tallhart and Beren Tallhart.
10.name: House: Tallhart

11.content: House Manderly of White Harbor is a noble northern family from the New Castle in White Harbor, and are vassals to Starks of Winterfell. Their emblem is a white merman with dark green hair, beard, and tail, holding a black trident against a blue-green backdrop. Their words are "A Promise Well Kept". House Manderly's vassals are: House Ashwood, House Holt, House Locke, House Long, House Slate, and House Woolfield. The current head of the house is Wylis Manderly, a bald man with a bushy walrus mustache that hides his mouth. Much like his dead father, Lord Wyman, Wylis is an immense, fat man, almost too big to ride a horse. His devoted wife, Leona, is plump with yellow hair and a round, fleshy, pink face. Wylis and Leona have two daughters: Wynafryd Manderly (brown hair in a lengthy braid) and Wylla Manderly (flowing blond locks, dyes her hair a green hue, styling it in a braid. She speaks with a thin, high voice and is brave).
11.name: House: Manderly

12.content: House Dustin is a major house in the North of Westeros, sworn to House Stark of Winterfell. Their castle is Barrow Hall in Barrowton, a prominent town in the north. Their sigil is a crown and longaxes on a yellow background. Their words are "Our Word Yet Lives". he current head of the house is Lady Barbrey Dustin, a Ryswell by birth. She is the widow of Willam Dustin, Lord of Barrowton. Barbrey is tall, unbent, and handsome. She has wrinkles around her mouth and dark eyes, and her hair is equal parts brown and grey. Lady Dustin wears her hair tied behind her head in a widow's knot. While intelligent, Barbrey has grown into a bitter woman over the years. Lady Dustin is distrustful of maesters and refers to them as grey rats. House Dustin has a few vassal houses, including House Stout of Goldgrass.
12.name: House: Dustin

13.content: House Cerwyn of Cerwyn is a noble house from the north. They are one of the closest bannermen to the Starks, Castle Cerwyn being just a half day's ride from Winterfell, and are among the most powerful as well. House Cerwyn's heraldry is a black battle-axe on silver. Their words are "Honed and Ready". The current ruler of House Cerwyn is Lord Medger Cerwyn. He and his wife have a son - Lord Cley Cerwyn, and a daughter - Lady Jonelle Cerwyn.
13.name: House: Cerwyn

14.content: House Glover of Deepwood Motte is a noble house from the north, sworn to the Starks of Winterfell. Galbart Glover is the Master of Deepwood Motte, which is located in the northwestern wolfswood. Houses Bole, Branch, Forrester, and Woods of the wolfswood are sworn to the Glovers. The sigil of House Glover is a silver mailed fist on scarlet. Their words are "With a Firm Hand". The current ruler of House Glover is Galbart Glover. Robett Glover is Galbart's younger brother and successor. Robett Glover is the husband of Sybelle Glover, and the father of two children, Gawen and Erena. Robett is tall, with a deeply-lined face and brown-grey hair. He wears mail beneath a red surcoat, and his scarlet cloak is clasped with a silver brooch in the shape of a mailed fist. Sybelle Glover is a pious woman who often prays in Deepwood's godswood.
14.name: House: Glover

15.content: House Reed of Greywater Watch is a noble house from Greywater Watch, and one of the principal families in the north. They rule the crannogmen, small men who live in the swamps and marshes of the Neck. They hold fealty to House Stark of Winterfell. House Reed's heraldry is a black lizard-lion on a grey-green field. Their words are "We Remember". Their vassals include: House Fenne, House Marsh, House Peat, House Boggs, House Cray, House Quagg, House Greengood, House Blackmyre. Lord Howland Reed is the Lord of Greywater Watch and the head of the house. At the end of Robert's Rebellion, he accompanied Eddard Stark to in an attempt to rescue Lyanna Stark, and participated in the Skirmish at the Tower of Joy. Howland is a small man, brave, strong, and smart. Jyana is Howland's wife. They have two children: Meera and Jojen Reed. Meera is skilled in hunting and survival. Jojen is gifted with prophetic dreams.
15.name: House: Reed

16.content: The Red Keep is a castle in King's Landing, the capital of the Seven Kingdoms. It's where King Robert I Baratheon resides. The castle is made of pale red stone and overlooks the mouth of the Blackwater Rush. It has seven large drum-towers with iron ramparts. The castle is surrounded by massive curtain walls with nests and crenelations for archers. Behind the walls, there are inner yards, vaulted halls, covered bridges, barracks, dungeons, granaries, kennels, and stables. The Red Keep has challenging serpentine steps. Below the steps, one'll find Maegor's Holdfast, the small council chambers, the Tower of the Hand, the lower bailey, a sunken courtyard, and the black cells. Above the steps is the Great Hall with the throne room, the outer yard, the godswood, the river walk, the small kitchen, and the pig yard. The royal sept and the Maidenvault are also located above the serpentine steps. Inside the Red Keep, one'll find relics of the Targaryen dynasty. The castle is home to many cats, including pets and strays. The Great Hall houses the king's throne room. The Iron Throne sits on a raised iron dais with a long carpet leading to the hall's oak-and-bronze doors. Behind the Iron Throne is the king's private exit. Maegor's Holdfas includes the Queen's Ballroom, the royal apartments and the king's bedchamber, which has a canopied bed and twin hearths. The Tower of the Hand houses the Hand of the King's chambers and the Small Hall. The White Sword Tower holds the chambers of the Kingsguard. The Red Keep has a godswood with elm, alder, and black cottonwood trees. Princess Myrcella Baratheon has her garden there. The Grand Maester has chambers beneath the rookery. Lord Varys, the master of whisperers, has snug apartments with three windowless chambers and a stone bed. The Red Keep has a network of secret passages and tunnels. Characters familiar with the secret passages include Maegor, Cheese, Lord Larys Strong, Varys, and Lord Petyr Baelish.
16.name: Location: Red Keep

17.content: Varys, known as the Spider, serves as the master of whisperers on King Robert I Baratheon's small council, a role he previously held under King Aerys II Targaryen. Varys is a plump, bald, and effeminate eunuch with soft white hands. He smells like lavender, lilacs, and rosewater. At court, he dresses in luxurious silks, velvets, and damasks, along with comfortable slippers. His outward manner is obsequious, mysterious, and squeamish. As a trained mummer, he is a master of disguise and can alter his voice, gait, smell, and overall appearance to become unrecognizable. Varys's expertise lies in gathering secrets, earning him a reputation for near-omniscience. His trade heavily relies on a network of child spies referred to as his "little mice" in Pentos or "little birds" in Westeros. Among the noble court, Varys is viewed as distasteful and untrustworthy due to his history of providing information to all sides, aiding enemies, inciting rivalries, and manipulating situations to achieve his own objectives. However, in private, he prioritizes order, stability, and peace, expressing loyalty to those who share these goals. Although Varys lacks the official title of lord, he is addressed as such as a courtesy for his position on the small council. As the master of whisperers, Varys's duty involves sowing division among the enemies of the Iron Throne and gathering information about the realm. Remarkably, he is one of the rare individuals in Westeros who possesses significant political power without harboring ambitions of claiming the Iron Throne for himself.
17.name: Person: Varys

18.content: House Flint of Widow's Watch is a noble house in the North. They hold fealty to House Stark of Winterfell. Their banner is a blue field strewn with whitecaps, on a yellow chief with crested line there's a pair of blue eyes. Their words are "Ever Vigilant". Lady Lyessa Flint is the head of the house. House Flint has vassals known as the Flints of the Mountains and House Flint of Flint's Finger.
18.name: House: Flint

19.content: Prince Rhaegar Targaryen, the eldest son of King Aerys II Targaryen and Queen Rhaella, was the Prince of Dragonstone and the heir to the Iron Throne. Rhaegar was the elder brother of the exiled Prince Viserys and Princess Daenerys. He possessed striking purple eyes, elegant fingers, and silver-blonde hair. Known for his intelligence, Rhaegar excelled in many pursuits. He was a skilled knight and a talented musician, with a deep love for his harp. Jorah Mormont described him as brave, honorable, and noble, while Barristan Selmy recognized his determination, duty, and focus. Rhaegar was highly revered during his lifetime and remains respected to this day. Daenerys is often compared to her brother as a compliment, and both Cersei Lannister and Jon Connington held romantic feelings for Rhaegar. Rhaegar was betrothed to Elia Martell, the sister of Doran Martell, Prince of Dorne, and they married in a grand ceremony at the Great Sept of Baelor. Rhaegar and Elia had two children, Rhaenys and Aegon. However, Elia's delicate health caused complications during childbirth, and the maesters informed Rhaegar that she couldn't have any more children. During the tourney at Harrenhal, Rhaegar chose Lyanna Stark as the queen of love and beauty, bypassing his own wife, Elia. This action marked the beginning of troubled times. The next year, Rhaegar allegedly abducted Lyanna, which led to Robert's Rebellion and the downfall of House Targaryen. Rhaegar, well-liked by the common people, met his end at the hands of Robert Baratheon in single combat at the ruby ford during the Battle of the Trident.
19.name: Person: Rhaegar Targaryen

20.content: Prince Joffrey Baratheon is known to the Seven Kingdoms as the eldest son and heir of King Robert I Baratheon and Queen Cersei Lannister. His siblings are Princess Myrcella and Prince Tommen. Joffrey has the Lannister look and is tall for a boy of his age, with blond curly hair. Known to be handsome, he has deep green eyes and pouty lips. Twelve years old, strong-willed. Although he can be gallant and courteous, he has an uncontrollable temper not unlike his mother, Queen Cersei Lannister, and an unchecked sadistic streak. He has little sense of right or wrong, which often leads him to trouble, especially when he loses his temper. Despite being willful he is reckless, vicious, cruel and not particularly intelligent, all of which combine to make him prone to irrational and bad judgements. He always wears the finest clothing and accents. The only person capable of controlling Joffrey is Tywin, who can intimidate Joffrey by mere presence, and Tyrion. Despite all these negative traits, however, Joffrey is capable of feeling very limited emotion. Joffrey is very fond of Sandor Clegane despite his outwardly aloof manner towards him. Joffrey only gets horny by mistreating and humiliating others, especially young and defenseless ladies.
20.name: Person: Joffrey Baratheon

21.content: Prince Tommen Baratheon is known to the Seven Kingdoms as the youngest child of King Robert I Baratheon and Queen Cersei Lannister. A member of House Baratheon of King's Landing, his siblings are Prince Joffrey and Princess Myrcella. He is 13 years old. Tommen is plump, with long white-blond hair. He has golden curls and emerald green eyes. Tommen, unlike Joffrey, is regarded as a good-hearted lad who always tries his best. Tommen is tenderhearted and not as strong-willed as his brother. Many other characters (except his mother) believe that he would be a much better king than Joffrey. Tommen is fond of applecakes, and enjoys reading. He is a clumsy but earnest dancer. He is afraid of Sandor Clegane. Tommen is a virgin and is obsessed with sex. Tommen feels an unhealthy attraction to his mother.
21.name: Person: Tommen Baratheon

22.content: Pyke is a castle on the island of the same name in the Iron Islands. It belongs to House Greyjoy. The castle is situated on three barren islands and several rock stacks, connected by rope bridges. It is made of grey-black stone, covered in green lichen. Ships dock at nearby Lordsport due to the lack of safe anchorage at Pyke. The castle is enclosed by a curtain wall encompassing the headland and cliffs.
22.name: Location: Pyke

23.content: Ironman's Bay is a bay of the Sunset Sea on the western coast of Westeros. The southern shore of Ironman's Bay lies along the northern westerlands, which includes the castle of Banefort. It extends to the east along the western riverlands; Seagard is built along the eastern shore. The northern shore of Ironman's Bay is the Cape of Eagles in the riverlands or Cape Kraken in the north. In the latter case the northwest of Ironman's Bay would also stretch along the west of the Neck and the Flint Cliffs. Ten Towers is located on the eastern shore of Harlaw in the Iron Islands. The bay is populated by cod, black cod, monkfish, skate, icefish, sardines, and mackarel.
23.name: Location: Ironman's Bay

24.content: Princess Myrcella Baratheon is known to the Seven Kingdoms as the middle child of King Robert Baratheon and Queen Cersei Lannister. A member of House Baratheon of King's Landing, her siblings are Princes Joffrey and Tommen. She is 14. Myrcella has golden curls, emerald eyes, and full lips. She is described by her uncle, Tyrion Lannister, as having all of her mother Cersei's beauty, but none of her mother's nature. Myrcella is delicate, beautiful, and courteous. For her age, she displays courage, a strong will, and high intelligence.
24.name: Person: Myrcella Baratheon

25.content: House Mallister of Seagard is a prominent noble house in the riverlands, sworn to House Tully of Riverrun. They're the Tully's most loyal vassals. Their lands are in the north of Riverrun, along the western coast of the Riverlands on Ironman's Bay, southwest the Twins. Seagard, their castle, serves as their seat. The Mallisters have long been enemies of the ironborn, Seagard was built as a stronghold against marauders from the Iron Islands.They defended the Riverlands' shores against Ironborn raiders for centuries. The sigil of House Mallister is a silver eagle on an indigo (or blue) background. Their words are "Above the Rest." Lord Jason Mallister, a mature yet strong and handsome man, is the head of the house and the Lord of Seagard. His son, Patrek Mallister, is the heir to Seagard. Ser Denys Mallister, Jason's uncle, serves in the Night's Watch as the commander of the Shadow Tower.
25.name: House: Mallister

26.content: House Stark of Winterfell is one of the Great Houses of Westeros and the principal noble house of the north. They're one of the oldest noble lines in Westeros, tracing their ancestry back over eight thousand years. Their sigil is a grey direwolf racing across a field of white. Their words are "Winter Is Coming". The vassals of House Stark are: House Cassel, House Cerwyn, House Dustin, House Glover, House Hornwood, House Manderly, House Mazin, House Reed, House Marsh, House Poole, House Seaworth, House Tallhart. Eddard “Ned” Stark is the honorable Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North. Catelyn Stark: Ned’s wife, fiercely protective of her family. Robb Stark: Their eldest son, the heir. Sansa Stark: their daughter. Arya Stark: the spirited younger daughter. Bran Stark: the middle son. Jon Snow: Ned’s supposed illegitimate son. Rickon Stark: the youngest son. Theon Greyjoy is a ward in Winterfell.
26.name: House: Stark

27.content: House Greyjoy of Pyke is one of Westeros' Great Houses, ruling over the Iron Islands. The family head carries the traditional title of Lord Reaper of Pyke. Their sigil is a golden kraken on a black field, while their motto is "We Do Not Sow," though they are closely associated with the phrase "What Is Dead May Never Die." House Greyjoy has a history of raiding and plundering their neighbors, and they follow the faith of the Drowned God. Vassals of House Greyjoy: House Harlaw, House Botley, House Goodbrother, House Blacktyde, House Volmark, House Saltcliffe, House Stonetree, House Sunderly, House Sparr, House Wynch, House Orkwood, House Tawney, House Drumm, House Farwynd, House Greyiron, House Merlyn, House Myre, House Netley, House Sharp, House Weaver. Currently,  House Greyjoy is led by Balon Greyjoy. Balon has two children: Theon and Yara. Theon Greyjoy is the heir of House Greyjoy, has been a ward of the Starks since childhood. Yara was raised at Pyke, she is a fierce warrior and commands her own longship, the Black Wind. Balon Greyjoy has two brothers: Euron and Aeron.
27.name: House: Greyjoy

28.content: Yara Greyjoy is a member of House Greyjoy, and is the daughter of Lord Balon Greyjoy by his wife, Alannys Harlaw. She is an older sister of Theon Greyjoy. In her mid-twenties, Yara is lean and long legged, with dark eyes and black hair cut short. Her face is thin, with a big, sharp nose, and wind-chafed skin. On her neck is a faded pink scar. Yara is a wild and headstrong young woman, raised by her mother to be bold. She possesses a sharp wit, and has no problem with holding her own against men, both in a verbal battle and in a physical fight. Yara enjoys ale and wine. Defying the classical gender roles of Westerosi culture, Yara was appalled early on by the idea of becoming a lord's wife. After her older two brothers died and her younger brother was taken hostage, Yara's father Balon began to see her as his heir, treating her like he would a son. Yara personally leads her men into battle. According to Yara, half of them love her like a daughter, while the other half want to sleep with her. Regardless, Yara loves her men, and is willing to die for them, as they are for her. Yara is also well liked by the servants of Pyke and people of Lordsport.
28.name: Person: Yara Greyjoy

29.content: Harrenhal, the biggest castle in the Seven Kingdoms, used to belong to House Whent and is situated in the riverlands, on the northern shore of the Gods Eye. However, now the castle has become a desolate and gloomy place. Harrenhal's lands are incredibly wealthy and encompass vast expanses of fertile green land that stretch all the way to the hills of House Wode near the crownlands. Harrenhal is incredibly fortified. It has five towering structures and equally massive walls. The walls are remarkably thick, and the rooms inside are constructed on such a grand scale that they would be more suitable for giants than humans. Harrenhal has the largest chamber in Westeros, even surpassing the throne room of the Red Keep. The castle covers three times the area of Winterfell, and its structures are so much larger that they can hardly be compared. Its stables can hold a thousand horses, its godswood spans twenty acres, and its kitchens rival the Great Hall of Winterfell in size. However, much of Harrenhal has fallen into disrepair. House Whent only occupies the lower portions of two out of the five towers, leaving the rest to deteriorate. Many areas within the castle have remained untouched for decades, and bats have infested the tops of some towers. The walls and towers of Harrenhal are constructed from black stone.
29.name: Location: Harrenhal

30.content: Lyanna Stark, daughter of Lord Rickard Stark and Lady Lyarra Stark, played a pivotal role in the history of Westeros. She had two older brothers, Brandon and Eddard, as well as a younger brother named Benjen. Lyanna was known for her beauty, described as both "wild and boyish" by Maester Yandel and possessing a "wild beauty" according to Kevan Lannister. She had a slender frame. Arya Stark, who has brown hair, a long face, and grey eyes resembles Lyanna. Eddard noted that Lyanna carried a touch of wildness within her, often referred to as "the wolf blood" by their father, Rickard Stark. Lyanna was a skilled rider who loved the thrill of horseback. She was originally betrothed to Robert Baratheon, the Lord of Storm's End. However, she seemed less enthusiastic about the match than Robert, expressing doubts to Ned about his faithfulness after their marriage. During a tourney at Harrenhal, Prince Rhaegar crowned Lyanna as the queen of love and beauty, despite being already married. Later Lyanna was abducted by Rhaegar Targaryen and taken to Dorne. Her brother Brandon went to King's Landing to demand Rhaegar's arrest, but he and his companions were charged with treason and executed by King Aerys II Targaryen. This sparked Robert's rebellion, which ultimately led to the downfall of House Targaryen. Lyanna died in Eddard Stark's arms after her rescue. Lyanna was buried in the crypt at Winterfell, next to her brother Brandon.
30.name: Person: Lyanna Stark

31.content: Riverrun is the ancestral castle of House Tully, the ruling family of the Riverlands. It's located in the western riverlands, where the Tumblestone and Red Fork rivers meet. The castle isn't massive but has strong red sandstone walls that rise straight from the water. Its battlements are crenelated with arrow holes, and the towers offer commanding views of the surrounding areas. Inside the castle, one'll find the keep, where the Lord of Riverrun resides. The keep is triangular, just like the castle itself. The Lord's solar, also triangular, has a stone balcony that extends eastward. The Great Hall is the main gathering place for the Tullys, with a high seat for the Lord and space for councils and meals. Above the Great Hall is a private audience chamber with another high seat and a bell to summon servants. There's also the godswood, a beautiful garden with elms, redwoods, wildflowers, streams, and nesting birds. The heart tree of the godswood is a slender weirwood with a sad face carved into it. Riverrun has dungeons that are dark, windowless, and damp. The castle also houses kennels, stables, and a brewhouse.
31.name: Location: Riverrun

32.content: Renly Baratheon is the Lord of Storm's End and Lord Paramount of the Stormlands. The younger brother of King Robert I and Lord Stannis, Renly serves as master of laws on Robert's small council. Renly is a powerful lean and lithe man. He has a handsome, clean-shaven face. Renly greatly resembles a young King Robert I Baratheon, being near as tall as his eldest brother had been. Like Robert, Renly has an easy smile. Renly's thick hair is as black as coal. Renly has blue-green eyes which change color depending on what he wears. Renly is a charismatic man, winning friends easily, but he also strikes some people as frivolous. Renly enjoys tourneys and hunting but is not driven by the passion for food, drink, or wenching as King Robert came to be. He is quite popular with smallfolk due to his good looks, friendly ways, and charisma. Renly wears expensive attire. He wields longsword and dagger. Unbeknownst to the realm at large, and despite the many women who are attracted to him, Renly is homosexual. According to his lover, Loras, Renly disdains book learning, believing that books should only be read by maesters. Renly is married to Margaery Tyrell.
32.name: Person: Renly Baratheon

33.content: Margaery Tyrell is the only daughter of Lord Mace Tyrell and his wife, Lady Alerie Hightower. She grew up in Highgarden, the family seat and regional capital of the Reach. She is 16. Margaery married Renly Baratheon to strengthen the bond between House Tyrell and House Baratheon. Margaery has thick, softly curling brown hair and large brown eyes. She has a slender but womanly figure with smooth and unblemished pale skin and small breasts. Margaery is fair and lively, with a shy and sweet smile. She is regarded as beautiful or pretty by most. Margaery is intelligent and shrewd, taking after her cunning grandmother, Lady Olenna Tyrell. Margaery is her protégée, and as such, Olenna has made certain that Margaery is capable of protecting herself from those who might use or abuse her. Varys describes Margaery as sweet and tractable. Margaery often goes for a ride, a trip by boat, or out hawking. The generous Margaery is popular with smallfolk. Margaery's attire includes a sheer gown of ivory silk, Myrish lace, and seed pearls.
33.name: Person: Margaery Tyrell

34.content: House Westerling of the Crag is a noble house from the Crag in the northwestern westerlands. They are sworn to House Lannister of Casterly Rock, and are considered among their principal bannermen. Their sigil is six seashells, white on sand. Their words are "Honor, not Honors". Lord Gawen Westerling is Lord of the Crag and the head of the house. Lady Sybell Spicer is his wife. Ser Raynald Westerling is Gawen's eldest son and heir. Jeyne Westerling is Gawen's his eldest daughter, betrothed to Robb Stark. Eleyna Westerling is Gawen's second daughter. Rollam Westerling is Gawen's second son.
34.name: House: Westerling

35.content: House Royce of Runestone is an ancient and influential noble family from the Vale, sworn to House Arryn. They reside in the castle Runestone, situated on the narrow sea coast north of Gulltown. House Royce of the Gates of the Moon - is a cadet branch of House Royce of Runestone. The Royces control several ports and do not depend on Gulltown for its commerce. House Royce's sigil features a pattern of black pebbles on a bronze field surrounded by runes in the Old Tongue of the First Men. Their house words are "We Remember". House Royce has two vassal houses: House Coldwater, House Tollett. The current leader of House Royce is Lord Yohn Royce, also known as "Bronze Yohn." The Royces are the most powerful family in the Vale after the Arryns, and they are extremely loyal to House Arryn.
35.name: House: Royce

36.content: The Eyrie is an ancient castle and the seat of House Arryn in the Vale of Arryn. It sits high up in the Mountains of the Moon on a part of the peak called the Giant's Lance, thousands of feet above the valley below. Despite being smaller compared to other Great Houses' seats in Westeros, the Eyrie is considered impenetrable. The captain of the House Arryn guards at the Eyrie is Ser Vardis Egen, and Colemon serves as the castle's maester. Mord is the gaoler, and the servingwomen include Gretchel, Maddy, and Mela. The castle also has a master-at-arms, a plump septon, and Mya Stone who brings fresh food from the valley below. The Eyrie is the smallest of the great castles, made of fine white stone. It consists of seven slim towers closely packed together, capable of housing five hundred men. The waterfall known as Alyssa's Tears can be heard from the Eyrie, and falcons often soar near the castle. Although the Eyrie lacks stables, smithies, and kennels, its granary is as large as those found in much bigger castles like Winterfell. It also has a sept, and the castle's household guard wears sky-blue cloaks. The High Hall is a long and simple hall with walls made of blue-veined white marble. It is adorned with rows of slim fluted pillars and a blue silk carpet. At the end of the hall, there are two thrones carved from weirwood, one for the lord and a smaller one for a consort. The Moon Door is a narrow weirwood door situated between two slender pillars in the middle of the High Hall. When opened, it reveals the sky and is often used for executions, leading to a drop of six hundred feet to the valley below. The Crescent Chamber serves as the reception hall in the Eyrie. Here, guests are offered refreshments and warmed by the fire after making the climb up the Giant's Lance. The Lower Hall is where food and wine can be served, while the Morning Hall, situated above the kitchens, is used for breakfast. The Maiden's Tower is the easternmost tower of the Eyrie. From its balcony, one can enjoy a view of the Vale and the Giant's Lance. The Moon Tower contains Lord Arryn's bedchambers. It is protected by a four-inch thick oaken door and has curtains of plush blue velvet. The window in the bedchamber has small diamond-shaped panes. The godswood of the Eyrie is surrounded by the castle's towers. However, it doesn't have a heart tree since weirwoods don't grow in the stony soil. Instead, the garden contains blue flowers, grass, shrubs, thin dark trees, and statues, including one of a weeping Alyssa Arryn in the center. The Eyrie's infamous dungeons are known as sky cells. They are shelves along the sheer cliffs of the mountain, exposed to the cold sky, with slightly sloping floors to unsettle the prisoners. Many prisoners go mad from the cold and winds and choose to end their lives rather than remain imprisoned.
36.name: Location: the Eyrie

37.content: Olenna Tyrell, née Redwyne, is the widow of Lord Luthor Tyrell and the mother of Mace Tyrell, Lord of Highgarden. Born into House Redwyne of the Arbor, she is commonly known as the Queen of Thorns because of her sharp tongue. Lady Olenna is a small woman, has soft, spotted hands, with gaunt thin fingers. Olenna smells of rosewater, but she also has has an old woman's sour breath and toothless smiles. Olenna walks with a cane. Olenna rarely shies from stating her opinion, and is a cunning old woman with a wicked wit and a sharp tongue. According to her granddaughter Margaery, she is not the most patient of women. Although Olenna regularly mocks members of her own family, she is a staunch supporter of Tyrell family interests and loves her familt dearly, especially her grandchildren. Her granddaughter Margaery is her favourite. Olenna Redwyne was betrothed to Prince Daeron Targaryen when they were both nine, but she claims she did everything she could to make sure it never came to fruition. Olenna later married Luthor Tyrell, the heir to Highgarden, who had also been spurned by his own Targaryen betrothed. At some point Luthor became Lord of Highgarden, and he and Olenna had three children together, Mace, Mina, and Janna. Olenna says she loved Luthor well enough, as he was kind and not unskilled in bed, but she still considered him an oaf. Olenna feels that her son Mace is also an oaf. Olenna has twin guardsmen named Erryk and Arryk, whom she refers to as "Left and Right" because she cannot tell them apart. A politically astute woman, Olenna has been a master of court politics and intrigue her entire life. Olenna's strength and competence in politics has made her the de facto head of House Tyrell and, by extension, the Reach itself. Olena secretly controls the trafficking of lyseni juice in Westeros, as well as other drugs and poisons.
37.name: Person: Olenna Tyrell

38.content: Stannis Baratheon is the head of House Baratheon of Dragonstone and the Lord of Dragonstone. He is the secondborn son of Steffon Baratheon, Lord of Storm's End, and Lady Cassana Estermont. He has an older brother, King Robert I Baratheon, and a younger brother, Lord Renly Baratheon. Stannis serves on Robert's small council as the master of ships. Stannis, like his brothers Robert and Renly, is a big man—tall, broad-shouldered, and strong. He has dark blue eyes, a heavy brow, and a fringe of black hair that resembles a shadowy crown. His close-trimmed beard covers his strong jaw. Stannis's face looks taut, like cured leather, with sunken cheeks and thin, pale lips. He often grinds his teeth. Stannis is a serious, stubborn, and unforgiving man with a strong sense of duty and justice. He takes great pride in his honor and fiercely defends it. Stannis is skilled as a commander, sailor, and warrior, but he doesn't actively seek out battles. Instead, he prefers to lead from the rear. Despite his abilities, he has never gained the affection of the nobility or the common people. In fact, he grows increasingly resentful of his brother Robert's lack of affection, even though he serves the king as well as he can. Stannis isn't one for pleasant manners and has always felt uneasy around women, including his own wife, Lady Selyse of House Florent. While he serves on the small council in King's Landing, he left his wife on Dragonstone and rarely communicated with her. Their physical relationship is infrequent and joyless. Although Stannis had hoped for sons, he has only a daughter named Shireen. Unlike many of his noble peers, Stannis dresses plainly.
38.name: Person: Stannis Baratheon

39.content: House Arryn is one of the Great Houses of Westeros and the ruling house of the Vale. Their sigil is a blue field with a white moon and a flying falcon above it, and their words are "As High as Honor". Their seat is the Eyrie, a castle located on a shoulder of the Giant's Lance. Lord Jon Arryn is the current Lord of the Eyrie, Defender of the Vale, and Warden of the East. Jon is the husband of Lady Lysa Arryn and father of Lord Robert Arryn. Jon Arryn is currently a Hand of the King to Robert Baratheon. Vassal houses of House Arryn include: House Royce, House Corbray, House Redfort, House Belmore, House Grafton, House Hunter, House Waynwood, House Templeton, House Lynderly, House Tollett, House Upcliff, House Shett, House Coldwater, House Egen, House Hardyng, House Sunderland, House Waxley, House Arryn of Gulltown.
39.name: House: Arryn

40.content: House Bracken of Stone Hedge is an old house from Stone Hedge in the Riverlands, one of the main families sworn to House Tully of Riverrun. Their lands are located along the banks of the Red Fork of the Trident. They rule over wider domains and can field a much larger army than their overlord of House Tully. The sigil of House Bracken is a crimson stallion upon a saffron background. Their words are "Fear Our Thunder", referencing the sound of galloping stallions. The current lord of House Bracken is Jonos Bracken. The Brackens hold an ancient grudge against their neighbors, the Blackwoods of Raventree Hall.
40.name: House: Bracken

41.content: Edmure Tully is Lord of Riverrun and Lord Paramount of the Trident. He is of middle age and has the typical Tully features, with auburn hair and blue eyes. Edmure is the son and heir of the late Lord Hoster Tully of Riverrun. He is the younger brother of Catelyn Stark and Lysa Arryn. As the Lord of Riverrun and Lord Paramount of the Trident, Edmure holds a position of power and influence in the Riverlands, one of the constituent regions of the Seven Kingdoms. Edmure is known for his sense of duty and his desire to prove himself as a capable leader. He is often eager to make a name for himself and seeks recognition for his accomplishments. However, he can be impulsive and sometimes makes decisions without fully considering the consequences. Despite his occasional missteps, Edmure is well-intentioned and genuinely cares for his people. Edmure has some skill in statecraft, having gained experience from participating in two wars. He is also a capable military commander. Edmure has a close relationship with his sister Catelyn. They share a strong bond and support each other. Edmure also has a good relationship with Lysa, although their interactions are less frequent.
41.name: Person: Edmure Tully

42.content: House Blackwood of Raventree Hall is an old house from Raventree Hall in the riverlands, one of the main families sworn to House Tully of Riverrun. Their sigil is a flock of ravens surrounding a black shield charged with a dead weirwood, on a scarlet field. Blackwoods are mostly slim, with black hair. Their words are "Always Watching". Their vassals are House Blanetree, House Ryger. The current ruling lord of House Blackwood is Tytos Blackwood.
42.name: House: Blackwood

43.content: House Frey, a noble house from the Riverlands, controls the Twins, a vital crossing point over the Green Fork of the Trident River. The lord is known as the Lord of the Crossing. Their sigil is two stone grey towers connected by a bridge on a dark grey field, symbolizing their ancestral seat, the Twins. House Frey's words are "We Stand Together."  The Freys don't like their northern neighbors, the crannogmen of the Neck ruled by House Reed of Greywater Watch, calling them pejorative names like "frogeaters" or "mudmen". Many current Freys share the weaselly or stoatish appearance of their common ancestor, Lord Walder.  They're vassals of House Tully. House Frey's vassal houses include: House Erenford, House Haigh, House Charlton. The head of the house is Lord Walder Frey. Lady Joyeuse Frey is Walder's eighth wife. The family continues to grow in both size and power, and they are now the most powerful bannermen of the Tullys. Walder Frey has numerous children, grandchildren, and great-grandchildren. Walder Frey's sons: Stevron Frey, Lothar Frey. Walder Frey's daughters: Roslin, Walda, Derwa, Waldra, Arwaya, Shirei Frey.
43.name: House: Frey

44.content: Prince Oberyn Martell, also known as the Red Viper, is a member of House Martell and the younger brother of Doran Martell, the Prince of Dorne, and Elia Martell. Oberyn has eight illegitimate daughters named the Sand Snakes, with the four youngest born to his current partner, Ellaria Sand. Oberyn openly acknowledges and supports them, equipping them with weapons for self-defense and granting them the freedom to choose their own paths in love and marriage. He possesses the typical features of a Dornishman, being tall, slender, graceful, and fit. His face has a serious and weathered look, with thin eyebrows, black viper-like eyes, and a sharp nose. Oberyn's hair is black with a few silver strands. He is renowned as a skilled warrior, swift and agile like a water snake. Oberyn is fiercely determined and has gained a fearsome reputation. According to his brother Doran, Oberyn is "deadly, dangerous, and unpredictable," and no one dares to challenge him. However, Doran also describes Oberyn as impulsive. Oberyn is clever and quick-witted, admitting to having a wild youth. He harbors a deep thirst for vengeance against those who harmed his sister Elia, with whom he shared a close bond in their childhood. Oberyn holds a strong dislike for Lord Mace Tyrell, but friendly relationship with Mace's son Willas. Oberyn has a fondness for fine horses.
44.name: Person: Oberyn Martell

45.content:
Princess Elia Martell, a Dornish noble from House Martell, was the sister of Doran and Oberyn Martell. She beautiful, with slender figure, black eyes, and delicate health. According to Barristan Selmy, Elia was a gentle, good, and gracious lady. He also says she was kind and clever, with a sweet wit. She had a very close bond with her brother Oberyn. She was married to the crown prince, Rhaegar Targaryen. Their marriage, though not romantic, seemed happy, although Elia's health, which had always been problematic, remained fragile. Elia was bedridden for half a year after giving birth to Rhaenys, and giving birth to Aegon nearly killed her. Following Aegon's birth, the maesters told Rhaegar that Elia would bear no more children. During the tourney at Harrenhal in 281 AC, Rhaegar crowned Lyanna Stark as the queen of love and beauty, passing over Elia. Soon after, Rhaegar left Elia and their newborn son Aegon at Dragonstone and disappeared with Lyanna, which sparked Robert's Rebellion. Elia's uncle, Prince Lewyn Martell of the Kingsguard, fought alongside Rhaegar at the Battle of the Trident but died. King Aerys kept Elia and her children in King's Landing as hostages. When House Lannister attacked King's Landing, Elia and her children suffered terrible fates. Princess Rhaenys was killed by Ser Amory Lorch, and Prince Aegon was murdered by Ser Gregor Clegane. Elia was raped and murdered by Ser Gregor. Lord Tywin Lannister claimed that he ordered the deaths of Elia's children to prove the loyalty of House Lannister to the rebel cause after his previous neutrality, but he had never ordered the rape. Oberyn believes that Tywin had Elia and her children killed as revenge for the slight he suffered when Aerys II refused the marriage of his son and heir, Prince Rhaegar Targaryen, to his daughter, Cersei Lannister. 
House Martell was enraged by the atrocities committed against Elia and her children. Oberyn desired to continue the war, but peace was negotiated by Lord Jon Arryn, the Hand of the King, who returned the body of Prince Lewyn to House Martell and spoke with Doran Martell, ending the possibility of further conflict.
45.name: Person: Elia Martell

46.content: Genna Lannister is a noblewoman of House Lannister wed to Ser Emmon Frey, with whom she has four children: Ser Cleos, Lyonel, Tion, and Walder Frey (Red Walder, don't confuse with the Lord Walder Frey of the Twins). Genna is the only daughter of the late Lord Tytos Lannister and Lady Jeyne Marbrand, and she is the younger sister of Tywin and Kevan Lannister. Genna is the aunt of Queen Cersei Lannister, Ser Jaime Lannister of the Kingsguard, and Tyrion Lannister, having taken on a maternal role for the siblings after the death of Tywin's wife, Lady Joanna Lannister. In her youth Genna was shapely, always threatening to overflow her bodice. However, now she has a square figure, and an enormous bosom with a broad and smooth face. Genna is intelligent and shrewd, loving and sarcastic. She bosses around her husband, Ser Emmon Frey, whom she considers inept. Genna is one of the few Lannisters who recognizes Tyrion's talent for political maneuvering. Genna had been her father's "precious little princess", and later her brother Tywin's as well. However, according to her, she fell out of Tywin's favor when she "disappointed him".
46.name: Person: Genna Lannister

47.content: House Tarbeck of Tarbeck Hall was a noble house from Tarbeck Hall near the Crag in the Westerlands. Their sigil was a seven-pointed star, parts silver parts blue, on silver and blue field. They participated in the Reyne-Tarbeck revolt on the side of House Reyne against the House Lannister. House Tarbeck was destroyed by Tywin Lannister along with the House Reyne and went completely extinct.
47.name: House: Tarbeck

48.content: House Reyne of Castamere is an extinct noble house of the Westerlands, formerly sworn to House Lannister of Casterly Rock. House Reyne was known for its wealth and power, and for a time, they were the second wealthiest family in Westeros, behind House Lannister. The sigil of House Reyne was a red lion rampant regardant with a forked tail on a silver field. House Reyne openly challenged House Lannister's rule over the Westerlands. In response, Tywin Lannister led his forces against them and put Castamere castle to the torch. All surviving members of House Reyne were put to the sword, including men, women, and children. The destruction of House Reyne was immortalized in the song "The Rains of Castamere".
48.name: House: Reyne

49.content: Casterly Rock is a castle and the seat of House Lannister. The capital of the westerlands, it is on the ocean road and overlooks the harbor of Lannisport and the Sunset Sea. Nearby strongholds include Kayce and Feastfires to the west, Sarsfield to the north, and Cornfield and Clegane's Keep to the south. The household of Casterly Rock includes Maester Creylen, Vylarr, Ser Benedict Broom, and Whitesmile Wat. Casterly Rock stands on a massive stone hill by the Sunset Sea. Deep within the Rock's base, there are extensive sea-carved caverns. The stone has been mined for ages, resulting in countless mineshafts and untouched gold veins. Within the stronghold itself, there're tunnels, dungeons, storerooms, barracks, halls, grand halls, stables, stairways, courtyards, balconies, gardens, a sept, passages, caves, mines, galleries, chutes, wells, armories, bedchambers, servant's quarters, and more. Casterly Rock is the strongest and most impregnable seat in all of Westeros. The Lion's Mouth serves as the main entrance, a vast natural cavern reaching two hundred feet high on the south face of the Rock. It's accessed via a wide stone stairway capable of accommodating twenty riders. At the base of the west face, there are sea gates large enough for ships to sail into the caverns, where the Lannisters have their protected docks, wharves, and shipyards. However, most of the Lannister fleet anchors in the nearby harbor of Lannisport, a port city to the south of the Rock. Inside Casterly Rock is the Golden Gallery, housing Lannister treasures, adorned with gilded ornaments and walls. The Hall of Heroes is where the valiantly fallen Lannisters and close relatives are laid to rest, and their ancestral armor is on display there. The Stone Garden is a godswood located within a cave in the Rock, featuring a twisted weirwood tree, one-tenth the size of Raventree Hall's, whose roots have nearly filled the cave, choking out other vegetation.
49.name: Location: Casterly Rock

50.content: Castamere is a ruined castle located south of the Crag and west of Ashemark in the northwestern westerlands; also nearby is Tarbeck Hall. The former seat of House Reyne, Castamere contains gold and silver mines. Castamere was destroyed by Ser Tywin Lannister when House Reyne rose in rebellion against him. Although the castle was destroyed; it is immortalized in the song "The Rains of Castamere." By the end of the rebellion, Castamere was left in ruins and all members of House Reyne were executed.
50.name: Location: Castamere

51.content: Lannisport is a walled city in the westerlands, situated less than a mile south of Casterly Rock, the home of House Lannister. It is located along the coast of the Sunset Sea, where the river road, the gold road, and the ocean road intersect. Lannisport is a major port in the Seven Kingdoms and is the largest settlement in the westerlands. In addition to the Lannisters, other distant relatives living in the city bear names such as Lanny, Lannett, and Lantell, many of whom have yellow hair. Lannisport is protected by strong and towering walls. The city is famous for its goldwork and skilled goldsmiths, and it produces a unique spiced honey wine. The well-trained City Watch ensures the safety of Lannisport, and there is a notable motherhouse in the city. Similar to King's Landing, Lannisport boasts high-quality brothels. Merchants from Lannisport engage in trade with their counterparts in the Free Cities. The harbor of Lannisport serves as the anchorage for the Lannister fleet, allowing for naval operations and trade.
51.name: Location: Lannisport

52.content: Gulltown is the main port city of the Vale of Arryn. It's southeast of the Eyrie and south of the nearby Runestone. While Gulltown is the largest settlement in the Vale, it is smaller compared to King's Landing, Lannisport, and Oldtown. House Grafton governs Gulltown, and there is also a branch of House Arryn, known as House Arryn of Gulltown. The city is fortified with walls. Gulltown plays a significant role as a crucial port and gateway to the Vale. Its well-protected harbor provides a safe haven for ships traveling from King's Landing to Braavos or the north. Its strategic position ensures a steady flow of trade, including exotic goods from across the narrow sea, even when the Mountain of the Moon passes are closed during winter. Gulltown is also known for its skilled seamstresses.
52.name: Location: Gulltown

53.content: House Templeton of Ninestars is a noble house from Ninestars in the Vale of Arryn, a powerful knightly family sworn to House Arryn. The head of the family is given the title of Knight of Ninestars. Although they are landed knights, the Templetons are very powerful, and their strength and influence are comparable to many lords. It is said they can easily raise a thousand men. Their sigil is nine stars, one of 7 points and eight of 6 points, upon a gold saltire on black. The current head of the house is Ser Symond Templeton.
53.name: House: Templeton

54.content: House Redfort of Redfort is one of the principal noble houses in the Vale of Arryn. Their sigil is a red castle on a white field within a red embattled border. The words of House Redfort are "As Strong As Stone". Lord Horton Redfort is the Lord of Redfort; he has thrice wed; Horton is a short, old man with a well-kept beard, grey hair, and mild eyes; he is polite. Ser Jasper Redfort is his son and the heir. Ser Creighton Redfort, is Horton's second son. Ser Jon Redfort is his third son. Ser Mychel Redfort is a new-made knight and Lord Horton's youngest son. Mychel is considered one of the best young swordsmen in the Vale, he is very gallant. Mychel Redfort is married to Ysilla Royce.
54.name: House: Redfort

55.content: House Corbray of Heart's Home is a vassal house which holds fealty to House Arryn of the Eyrie. It is an old but poor house. The ancestral Valyrian steel longsword of the Corbrays is Lady Forlorn. Lady Forlorn has a heart-shaped ruby in its pommel. The sigil of House Corbray features three black ravens in flight holding three red hearts on a white background. Their vassals are House Dutton and House Crayne. The current ruler of House Corbray is Lord Lyonel Corbray. His wife, the daughter of a rich merchant of Gulltown, is pregnant with Lyonel's child.
55.name: House: Corbray

56.content: Essos is an immense landmass located to the east of Westeros, extending into the far east of the known world. The Free Cities are located on its north-western shores, with the Dothraki Sea located deep in the continental interior and the cities of Slaver's Bay on the south coast. The continent extends far to the east, around the Jade Sea, to the distant and fabled lands of Asshai and the Shadow. Essos climate is temperate in the northern and western portions, and subtropical in the southern & eastern portions. Rainfall generally decreases as one moves eastward in Essos. The Nine Free Cities are former colonies of the Valyrian Freehold before its fall (except for Braavos, which was founded by refugees fleeing slavery in Valyria): Braavos, Lorath, Lys, Myr, Norvos, Pentos, Qohor, Tyrosh, Volantis. Each is now an independent city-state, competing amongst themselves for land and resources and forming various shifting alliances.
56.name: Location: Essos

57.content: King's Landing is the capital of the Seven Kingdoms, located on the east coast of Westeros in the crownlands. It sits at the mouth of the Blackwater Rush, overlooking Blackwater Bay. The Red Keep there serves as the seat of King Robert Baratheon. The city is surrounded by a wall and guarded by the City Watch, also known as the gold cloaks. While King's Landing is the most populous city in Westeros, it is considered unsightly and unclean when compared to other cities. Poorer residents have built shanty settlements outside the city, and the stench of the city's waste extends beyond its walls. King's Landing is a bustling harbor and one of the largest cities in Westeros, second only to Oldtown in size. It is roughly square-shaped, spreading across several miles and protected by tall walls. The city is filled with various buildings such as mansions, arbor-covered areas, granaries, storehouses, inns, market stalls, taverns, graveyards, and brothels. The harbor features numerous quays, and the roads between buildings are broad, lined with trees and branching alleys. Outside the city walls near the quays, one'll find ramshackle buildings such as bait shacks, warehouses, stalls, alehouses, and rooms used for prostitution. Generally, the wealthier areas of the city are located on the higher elevations of the three hills, while the poorer sections occupy the lower areas in between. The most impoverished district is Flea Bottom, a maze of narrow streets and alleys at the base of Rhaenys's Hill. Here, the poorest residents struggle to survive, often relying on a mysterious stew known as "bowls of brown." King's Landing features seven grand gates, each protected by a portcullis, heavy doors, and guards. Notable locations within the city include the Red Keep, Maegor's Holdfast, the Tower of the Hand, the Great Sept of Baelor, the collapsed Dragonpit, the Guildhall of the Alchemists, and Flea Bottom. Tournaments are frequently held outside the city, near the Blackwater and the King's Gate.
57.name: Location: King's Landing

58.content: House Targaryen of Dragonstone is a noble family of Valyrian descent who once ruled the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros. The Targaryen sigil is a red three-headed dragon, breathing red flames on black. The house words are "Fire and Blood". House Targaryen ruled as the Kings of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and the First Men, the Lords of the Seven Kingdoms, and the Great House of the crownlands for nearly three hundred years. Seventeen male Targaryens sat on the Iron Throne. The dynasty ended with the death of Aerys the Mad King during Robert’s Rebellion, when House Baratheon replaced them. The surviving Targaryen children, Viserys and Daenerys, fled into exile in the Free Cities of Essos1.
58.name: House: Targaryen

59.content:
House Payne is a noble house from the Westerlands. It is one of the principal houses sworn to House Lannister. Their arms are purple and white chequy with gold coins in the checks. The current head of the house is Ser Ilyn Payne, known as the King’s Justice, he serves as the executioner. His loyalty to Tywin Lannister is unwavering.
Ser Podrick Payne is a distant cousin of Ser Ilyn.
59.name: House: Payne

60.content: House Marbrand of Ashemark is one of the main noble houses from the Westerlands. Their seat of Ashemark is located in the hilly area near where the Tumblestone begins. A vassal house to House Lannister. The sigil of House Marbrand is a burning tree, depicted as orange on smoke grey. Their words are "Burning Bright". Lord Damon Marbrand is he current head of the family. Ser Addam Marbrand is Lord Damon’s eldest son and heir. Ser Addam is one of the chief knights in the service of Tywin Lannister, Lord of Casterly Rock. Addam is rangy, with shoulder-length dark copper hair, gallant, brave and charming. Lady Jeyne Marbrand is the wife of Tytos Lannister. Darlessa Marbrand is the wife of Tygett Lannister. House Marbrand has close ties to the Lannisters through marriage.
60.name: House: Marbrand

61.content: Princess Arianne Nymeros Martell, a member of House Martell, is the heir to Sunspear. In her early twenties, Arianne is a buxom and stunning woman. She has olive skin, large dark eyes, and long, thick black hair that cascades in curls down her back. Standing at a height of five feet two inches, she takes after her mother Mellario in terms of stature. Arianne is calculating, adventurous, and quick-tempered. She is not shy about leveraging her looks to achieve her goals, even resorting to seducing men to do her bidding. She considers handsome men her great weakness, especially those with an alluring and forbidden aura. Arianne has a vivid sexual imagination. Born in 276 AC, Arianne is the eldest child of Prince Doran Martell of Dorne and Lady Mellario of Norvos. According to Rhoynish customs and Dornish laws, she is her father's designated heir as the firstborn. During her early years, she resided at the Water Gardens. Although she has two younger brothers, Quentyn and Trystane, she was never particularly close to them. When it comes to her romantic interests, Arianne has been involved with several individuals. These include Ser Daemon Sand, Ser Gerold Dayne, and Ser Arys Oakheart.
61.name: Person: Arianne Martell

62.content: House Lannister of Casterly Rock is one of the Great Houses of Westeros, one of its richest and most powerful families and one of its oldest dynasties.  The sigil of House Lannister is a golden lion rampant on a crimson background. Their house words are "Hear me roar". However, their unofficial motto, which is more commonly known, is "Lannisters always pay their debts". The Lannisters rule over the Westerlands by tradition. They have a cadet branch: House Lannister of Lannisport. Lannisters have a reputation for being comely with fair, golden hair and emerald green eyes. Lannisters are known for wearing crimson cloaks, and their household guard are known as the red cloaks. Their vassals include: House Clegane, House Crakehall, House Greenfield, House Hetherspoon, House Lefford, House Lorch, House Marbrand, House Payne, House Sarsfield, House Serrett, House Swyft, House Westerling, and House Yarwyck. Tywin Lannister is the head of the house. His daughter Cersei is the queen of King Robert I Baratheon. Ser Jaime Lannister is Cersei’s twin, a skilled knight of the Kingsguard. Tyrion Lannister is Tywin’s youngest child, a dwarf with wit and intelligence. Ser Kevan Lannister is Tywin’s younger brother, loyal and capable. Ser Lancel Lannister is Kevan’s son, initially a squire.
62.name: House: Lannister

63.content: House Crakehall is a vassal house that holds fealty to House Lannister of Casterly Rock. Their lands are located at the Searoad, at the south of the Westerlands, between the sea and a large forest. The current head of the family is Desmond Crakehall. The Crakehall sigil is a black and white brindled boar on brown. Their house words are "None So Fierce." Vassals of House Crakehall: House Hawthorne, House Parren, House Stackspear. Lord Roland Crakehall is Lord of Crakehall. Ser Tybolt Crakehall is his eldest son and heir to Crakehall. Ser Lyle Crakehall is his second son, called Strongboar. Ser Merlon Crakehall is his third son.
63.name: House: Crakehall

64.content: House Lefford of the Golden Tooth is one of the principal houses sworn to House Lannister of Casterly Rock. The seat of the House is the Golden Tooth. The castle controls the main entrance to the Westerlands from the east. The Lefford sigil is a golden inverted pile on sky blue, a sun left in the sky. The house words of House Lefford are "None Shall Pass". Lady Alysanne Lefford is the current head of the house.
64.name: House: Lefford

65.content: Arya Stark, an 12-year-old girl is the third child and second daughter of Lord Eddard Stark and Lady Catelyn Stark. She has distinct features such as a long face, grey eyes, and brown hair. She has a slender and athletic build. Her appearance often leads to her being mistaken as a boy. Her siblings include an older sister named Sansa, an older brother named Robb, two younger brothers named Bran and Rickon Stark, and her "bastard half-brother" Jon Snow. Refusing to conform to traditional expectations, Arya rejects the notion of becoming a lady and marrying for political influence and power. Instead, she craves the ability to shape her own destiny and finds fascination in warfare and combat training. She finds activities typically associated with femininity, such as embroidery, uninteresting and prefers pursuits more commonly associated with boys. Her relationship with her sister Sansa is often strained due to their differing interests and personalities. She has a pet direwolf called Nymeria. Arya resembles her deceased aunt Lyanna.
65.name: Person: Arya Stark

66.content: Jon Snow is the bastard son of Eddard Stark, Lord of Winterfell. He has five half-siblings: Robb, Sansa, Arya, Bran, and Rickon Stark. Unaware of the identity of his mother, Jon was raised at Winterfell. Jon is 14 years old. Jon has the long face of the Starks. He has dark brown hair and grey eyes, so dark they almost seem black. He is graceful and quick, and has a lean build. Jon resembles his father, Lord Eddard Stark, and has more Stark-like features than any of his half-brothers. Jon looks solemn and guarded, and is considered sullen and quick to sense a slight. Jon is observant, a trait he developed on account of being a bastard. He is a capable horseback rider and is well practiced in fighting with a sword. He desires to be viewed as honorable and wants to prove he can be as good and true as his half-brother, Robb. Jon dreams he would one day lead men to glory, or even become a conqueror. He feels strongly about not fathering a bastard himself. While Lord Eddard openly acknowledged Jon as his son and allowed him to live at Winterfell with his half-siblings, Jon feels like an outsider nonetheless. While Jon has good relationships with his siblings, especially Robb, with whom he trained since they were children, and Arya, whom he sees as somewhat of an outsider as well, Eddard's wife Catelyn ensured that Jon was never truly one of them. Jon is not close to Theon Greyjoy, Eddard's ward. Lord Stark refuses to speak of Jon's mother, and the boy grew up unaware of her identity, something which has wounded and haunted him. When Jon dreams of her, he considers her to be beautiful, highborn, and kind. Jon has an albino direwolf, named Ghost. Ghost is the litter-mate of Grey Wind, Lady, Nymeria, Summer, and Shaggydog.
66.name: Person: Jon Snow

67.content: House Tarly of Horn Hill is a noble house of the Reach, one of the strongest sworn to House Tyrell. The Tarly sigil features a striding huntsman in red against a green background. Their motto is "First in Battle". Lord Randyll Tarly is the head of the house and Lord of Horn Hill. Lady Melessa Tarly (nee Florent) is his wife. Samwell Tarly is his eldest son, steward of the Night's Watch. Talla Tarly is his daughter along with other two. Dickon Tarly is Randyll's younger son and heir. Eleanor Mooton is Dickon's wife, heir to Maidenpool.
67.name: House: Tarly

68.content: House Redwyne of the Arbor is a vassal family from the Reach, loyal to House Tyrell of Highgarden. They reside on the Arbor, an island southwest of Highgarden, renowned for producing the finest wines in Westeros. House Redwyne is one of the most powerful noble families in the Reach, owning a large fleet of ships due to their island location and involvement in the wine trade. The Redwyne sigil is a cluster of violet grapes on an azure field. Their words are "Ripe For Victory". They have a close relationship with their overlords. Redwynes typically have freckles and orange hair. Lady Olenna Tyrell, also known as the "Queen of Thorns", originally belonged to House Redwyne. The current head of the house is Lord Paxter Redwyne. Paxter is stooped of shoulder, thin, and balding with only a few orange tufts of hair remaining. Lady Mina Tyrell, Paxter's wife and first cousin, is the sister of Lord Mace Tyrell and daughter of Lady Olenna Tyrell. Ser Horas Redwyne is Paxter's son and heir, and the elder twin of Ser Hobber. Ser Hobber Redwyne is Paxter's son and the younger twin of Ser Horas. Desmera and {{user}} Redwyne are daughters of Paxter and Mina.
68.name: House: Redwyne

69.content: House Florent of Brightwater Keep is a vassal house that holds fealty to House Tyrell. Their seat is Brightwater Keep. Their sigil is a red-gold fox's head encircled by lapis lazuli flowers. Selyse Florent is the wife of Stannis Baratheon. Members of House Florent tend to have prominent ears. The current ruler is Ser Colin Florent, who has 3 chldren: Delena Florent, married to Ser Hosman Norcross; Omer Florent, a maester of the Citadel in service at Old Oak; Merrell Florent, a squire at the Arbor.
69.name: House: Florent

70.content: House Hightower of the Hightower is one of the most ancient, wealthy and powerful noble houses in the Reach and Westeros. Vassals to House Tyrell. Their seat is the Hightower in Oldtown. Their sigil is a white stone watchtower with a flaming top. Their motto is "We Light the Way," and they possess the Valyrian steel sword Vigilance. They prefer trade over war and have managed to avoid many conflicts. House Hightower members typically have silver or golden hair. Their vassals are: House Beesbury, House Bulwer, House Costayne, House Cuy, House Mullendore.  The current head of House Hightower is Lord Leyton Hightower. He has been married four times, his current wife is Rhea Florent. Lord Leyton's children: Baelor Hightower (eldest son, the heir, married to Rhonda Rowan of House Rowan), Malora Hightower (called the Mad Maid, eldest daughter, Lord Leyton sometimes consults her on books of spells and magic), Garth Hightower (called Greysteel, second son, a knight), Alerie Tyrell (married Mace Tyrell), Leyla Hightower (married to Ser Jon Cupps).
70.name: House: Hightower

71.content: Oldtown is a city situated on Whispering Sound along the southwestern coast of the Reach. It was built around the Hightower, the stronghold of House Hightower on Battle Isle. In Oldtown, you'll find the Citadel, where maesters and their Conclave reside, as well as the Starry Sept, once the seat of the High Septon of the Faith of the Seven. Oldtown is the largest and wealthiest city in the Seven Kingdoms, although King's Landing has now surpassed it in population. The city lies at the mouth of the Honeywine River in the southwestern part of the Reach. Honeyholt and Brightwater Keep are located north of the city, while Uplands is to the east, and Blackcrown and Three Towers are to the west. The Roseroad connects Oldtown to Highgarden and continues on to King's Landing. The city is made of stone, with cobbled streets that can be slippery on damp days. Most bridges are also constructed of stone, although a few wooden ones can be found. Oldtown is encircled by massive, thick stone walls. Oldtown is a maze of winding alleys, narrow streets, and bustling markets. The city is renowned for its beauty and fragrant aroma, often described as flowery. During summer, it can be hot and humid during the day but comes alive at night. The city is adorned with foliage such as melons, moonbloom, nightshade, peaches, and pomegranates. Traders from all over the world, including the Free Cities, the Summer Isles, and beyond, visit Oldtown's port.
71.name: Location: Oldtown

72.content: Highgarden, the castle that serves as House Tyrell's seat, sits at the intersection of the Mander and the meeting point of the ocean road and the roseroad, making it a vital crossroads. The Lord of Highgarden is Mace Tyrell, and notable members of the castle's household include Lord Seneschal Garth Tyrell, Maester Lomys, the master-at-arms Ser Vortimer Crane, and the fool Butterbumps. Leading the castle guards is Captain Igon Vyrwel. Highgarden is situated on a wide, lush hill that overlooks the Mander. The castle is encircled by three tiers of white stone walls, each higher than the previous one, with crenellations. Positioned between the outer and middle walls is a renowned briar labyrinth, which serves both as entertainment and a deterrent to invaders.
